definition: the ways of the world
life/age/generation/era/world/lifetime/epoch/descendant/noble
surname Shi
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang

sentences.english: Don't fight with the world, again good only vanity, silently at.
sentences.chinese: 不要與世相爭，再好也只不過是虛榮，要靜靜逍遙。

sentences.english: Li Shixiang is a Professor of Inner Mongolia University, famous composer.
sentences.chinese: 李世相是內蒙古大學藝術學院教授，著名作曲家。

sentences.english: You're getting a hidden peek, a peek into the world of what's really going on.
sentences.chinese: 你正偷偷瞥看，瞥到人生世相的真實一面。

definition: (Buddhism) the world of the living
the ways of the world/social behavior
worldly affairs/the ways of the world
ostentatious/pretentious/showy
affairs of life/things of the world
miscellaneous/mixed and disorderly (of writing)/disordered and confusing/mixed-up and illogical
every living being (Buddhism)/the mass of common people
circumstances/atmosphere/mood
human nature/humanity/human/the totality of human attributes
variable/changeable/fickle/impermanence (Sanskrit: anitya)/ghost taking away the soul after death/to pass away/to die
faint/subtle (of sound, scent etc)/profound/mysterious/dim
scenery/sights
joys and sorrows/partings and reunions/the vicissitudes of life
fabricated
the world of mortals (Buddhism)/human society/worldly affairs
diverse and muddled/many and confused
